fig.title: EPD_ON Topology diagram H204 H404 H444 H484

image.href: FIG_epd_on topology diagram h204 h404 h444 h484_1.png

entry.p: R2 is a placeholder and left it open or do not populate for H204/H404/H444/H484
This signal is originating from the PCH die that are required for the CPU and GPU to boot and work properly.

Route all the EPD* signals far away from the noisy source/signal. Refer to "Switching VR Circuit Guideline" chapter in PDG for the details. (Technical White Paper Doc#: 726825). Follow the small routing length as possible.
Place R1 and R2 closer to GCD_IN pin (R1 and R2 are used as voltage divider to get 1.12V for H12Xe/H10Xe GCD)
